\f0\fs24 \cf0 === Default Displayname ===\
Contributors: zacorehawa, vtxyzzy\
Donate link: http://example.com/\
Tags: admin, display names, default, comments\
Requires at least: 2.5\
Tested up to: 4.0.1 \
Stable tag: 4.1\
License: GPLv2 or later\
License URI: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.html\
\
Makes a defualt display name for new users as ‘Firstname Lastname”.\
\

Description ==\

\
This plugin allows site administrators to set a default way for the displayname that is show over the site. Default it’s set as firstname and lastname but that can be changed in the plugin editor in plugins.\
\
This only sets the setting, it does not remove the setting so to can be changed manually if needed.\
\
\

Installation ==\

\
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.\
\
\
1. Upload default_displayname.php to the /wp-content/plugins/default_displayname directory (create if needed)\
2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress\
4. Or find it in your wordpress install and install it without having to upload anything\
\

Frequently Asked Questions ==\

\

Does this need any settings changed

\
\
Nope, it\’92ll work as soon as you activate this plugin. It will then set the display name as the first and last name for any new users.\
\
\

Screenshots ==\

\
1. Shows the setting that will be set as default /assets/screenshot-1.png\
\
\

Changelog ==\

\

1.0

\
Plugin put together\
\

Upgrade Notice ==\

\

1.0

\
Working fine\
\
\
}
